metadata.title: CVE-2013-1889 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
mod_ruid2 before 0.9.8 improperly handles file descriptors which allowsremote attackers to bypass security using a CGI script to break out of thechroot.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1889` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-ruid2 - 0.9.8-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libapache2-mod-ruid2 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.8-3').
